title: Calories in Bourbon Whiskey
meta_description: Discover calories in bourbon whiskey per standard shot, including full nutrition breakdown, alcohol content, and serving tips for 80-proof varieties.
assumptions: Standard 1.5 fl oz (44 ml) serving of 80-proof (40% ABV) bourbon whiskey, straight, no mixers.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by proof, brand, distillation, and serving size. Higher proof increases calories; always check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A standard 1.5 oz shot of 80-proof bourbon whiskey contains about 97 calories, all from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Mixed with 4 oz diet soda (zero-calorie mixer)
Aged bourbon with caramel notes (slight sugar variation)

faqs.q: How many calories in one shot of bourbon whiskey?
faqs.a: About 97 calories for a 1.5 oz shot of 80-proof bourbon.

faqs.q: Does bourbon whiskey have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, or sugars—calories come entirely from alcohol.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in bourbon whiskey?
faqs.a: Higher proof means more calories; e.g., 100-proof adds ~24 kcal per shot versus 80-proof.

faqs.q: Calories in bourbon whiskey vs. other whiskeys?
faqs.a: Similar for most whiskeys at 80-proof (~97 kcal per shot); flavored varieties may add 10–50 kcal.

faqs.q: Is bourbon whiskey low in sodium or fat?
faqs.a: Yes, negligible fat (0 g), sodium (~0.3 mg), and no cholesterol per shot.
